Utterance: Welcome back! It’s good to see you again. How have you been since our last session?
Hi! I’ve been okay, but I didn’t really reach out to anyone yet.
That’s alright! Change takes time. What do you think held you back from reaching out?
I think I just got caught up in my routine and didn’t prioritize it.
That’s understandable. Sometimes life can get in the way. Would you like to set a specific time or day to reach out this week?
Yeah, I could try to do it this weekend.
That sounds like a great plan! Who do you think you might reach out to?
Probably the friend I mentioned last time. I think I’ll just send a text to check in.
That’s a good choice. What do you plan to say?
Maybe just something simple like, “Hey, how have you been?”
That’s perfect! It opens the door for conversation without putting too much pressure on either of you. How do you feel about sending that message?
I feel a bit nervous, but also excited to connect.
That’s a great mix of emotions! It’s normal to feel nervous when reaching out. Have you practiced any mindfulness exercises since our last session?
I did! I tried the breathing exercise a couple of times, and it really helped me feel calmer.
Classified_Subsection: History of Present Illness (HPI): Therapeutic Interventions

Utterance: Wonderful! It’s great to hear that you’re finding it helpful. Have you noticed any changes in how you handle stress since incorporating it?
I think I’m a bit more aware of when I’m feeling overwhelmed, so I try to take a moment to breathe.
Classified_Subsection: History of Present Illness (HPI): Current Functional Status

Utterance: That’s an important skill to develop. Being aware of your feelings is a huge step towards managing them. Have there been any moments where you felt particularly overwhelmed recently?
Yeah, at work, I had a project that was really stressful, but I took a break and did the breathing exercise, which helped.
Classified_Subsection: History of Present Illness (HPI): Current Functional Status

Utterance: That’s fantastic! It sounds like you’re starting to build a toolkit for managing stress. Is there anything else you’d like to add to that toolkit?
Maybe some journaling. I think writing about my day could help me process things better.
Journaling can be very therapeutic. It allows you to reflect on your feelings and experiences. Would you like to set a goal for how often you’d like to journal?
I could try to do it a couple of times a week.
That sounds like a reasonable goal! How about we check in on that next time?
Sure, I can do that.
Great! As we wrap up today, what are you feeling most hopeful about moving forward?
I’m hopeful that I can start reaching out to friends more and feel less isolated.
That’s a wonderful hope to hold onto. I believe you can achieve that. Thank you for sharing today, and I look forward to hearing about your progress in our next session!
Thank you! See you next time.
